meta.title: Project: Fix my code | Holberton Rennes, France Intranet

div.data-react-props: {"metadata":{"level":"Amateur","author":"Guillaume","weight":1,"migrated_to_sasheck":true,"task_level_review_type":"Your score will be updated as you progress.","correction":{"released":false,"requires_manual_correction":false}},"project":{"completion":0.0,"id":2217,"index":0,"isAccessible":true,"isOptional":false,"imagePath":"/assets/pathway/001_color-bb105595db22648e67fe1bf13ccc170165764f9c481034cdfd49dbb416af34af.png","name":"Fix my code","score":{"mandatory":0.0,"optional":0.0},"tasksCount":0},"slackLink":null,"tags":[],"videoRoomLink":null}

div.p: Fix my code is a new type of project, where we’ll jump into an existing code base and fix it!
Sometimes you will know the language, sometimes not.
Please download the repository Fix_My_Code_Challenge and use it as initial files for all solutions.
You should not recode everything, just fix it!

This project is NOT mandatory at all. It is 100% optional. Doing any part of this project will add a project grade of over 100% to your average. Your score won’t get hurt if you don’t do it, but if your current average is greater than your score on this project, your average might go down. Have fun!

ul.li: All your files will be compiled on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS
All your files should end with a new line
A README.md file, at the root of the folder of the project is mandatory

div.p: Please take a look at my implementation of FizzBuzz in Python: source code
Something is going wrong….

pre.code: $ ./0-fizzbuzz.py 50 1 2 Fizz 4 Buzz Fizz 7 8 Fizz Buzz 11 Fizz 13 14 Fizz 16 17 Fizz 19 Buzz Fizz 22 23 Fizz Buzz 26 Fizz 28 29 Fizz 31 32 Fizz 34 Buzz Fizz 37 38 Fizz Buzz 41 Fizz 43 44 Fizz 46 47 Fizz 49 Buzz $

div.p: 15 should print FizzBuzz not Fizz

div.h4: Students who are done with "0. FizzBuzz"

div.p: Please take a look at my implementation of printing a square in Javascript: source code
Something is going wrong….
./1-print_square.js 10 should print a square of size 10…

div.h4: Students who are done with "1. Print square"

div.p: Please find here my implementation of sorting arguments in Ruby: source code
Something is going wrong….

div.h4: Students who are done with "2. Sort"

div.p: Please find here my implementation of a User class in Python: source code
Something is going wrong….

pre.code: $ ./3-user.py Test User is_valid_password should return True if it's the right password $

div.p: My tests should not print any error…

div.h4: Students who are done with "3. User password"

div.p: Please find here my implementation of a Double linked list in C: source code
Something is going wrong….
It doesn’t look right…

div.h4: Students who are done with "4. Double linked list"

| Column 1 | Column 2 | Column 3 | | -------- | -------- | -------- | | John | Doe | Male | | Mary | Smith | Female |
Or without aligning the columns...
